conclusion: To determine if displacements are the same, analyze area under velocity-time graph.
Velocity-time graph shows curves for car A and car B; x-axis is time, y-axis is velocity.
At t=0, car A has lower initial velocity v1, car B has higher initial velocity v2.
Car A's velocity increases, car B's velocity decreases until they intersect before t1.
After intersection, car A's velocity continues to increase, car B's velocity continues to decrease until t1.
Displacement is given by area under velocity-time curve.
Approximate areas using geometric methods or numerical integration.
Count grid squares under each curve to compare areas.
Number of grid squares under car A's curve equals number under car B's curve from t=0 to t1.
Areas under curves are equal, so displacements of cars A and B are the same.
Final answer: Yes, displacements are the same from t=0 to t1.
